WorkItem.Description:
I'm building off 35211, The elemental shaman optimizer keeps freezing part way through the optimizatin process.
 
I was previously building off 35201, but had manually applied the patches that went into 35204, and 35211. It would ocassionaly lock up, but not consistantly, and not when I had put all my buffs on. At that time I did not have Valorous Worldbreaker Gloves ( item level 219 set gloves ) http://www.wowarmory.com/item-info.xml?i=45406. Now it locks up every time. Unfortunately I'm posting this from work so don't have my proper character.
 
I'm running it on windows 7 64 bit, built using the new visual studio beta (i'll have to check the number from home ) I tried turning on break on all exceptions, but nothing seems to be being thrown ( other than when I load my character or switch from resto to elemental in rawr )
 
If I wanted to debug why it is breaking where is a good place to start? is there debug logging to see why the optimizer might be freezing or what step it is on? It seems to break in different spots depending on if I say I have arcane intellect, or moonkin buffs. I'm guessing this is only the genetic algorithm randomly picking a different character?
 
Does it make more sense to post my character somehow and create an issue for this?

Comments.Message:
i'm not sure if buffs will transfer but i have the following ones checked.   

Improved Moonkin ( on or off )
arcane int ( 0n or off )

blessing of wisdom
improved blessing of wis
elemental oath
wrath of air
totem of wrath
divind spirit
mark of the wild
blessing of kings
totem of wrath
improved faerie fire
flask of the frost wyrm and mixology
fish feast


under options i've got the ration 25 burst, 75 sustained
5 min fight
30% spent with replenishment
use thunderstorm
round n and m up 

i do not usually override regem.
Since it works flawlessly for me, I suggest you delete your local ItemCache an try it once more.
I tried just deleting the itemcache.xml file and it froze again. I deleted the entire bin dir and rebuilt and that worked though.  cool I'll remember that for next time.
